title: Thomas Jefferson Memorial: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture            The Memorial Dedicated by President Franklin Delano Roosevelt on April 13, 1943, the Thomas Jefferson Memorial stands in a straight line with the White House.  Architect John Russell Pope, influenced by Jefferson's taste in classical architecture, echoed the style seen in Jefferson's two most famous buildings - Monticello and the University of Virginia Rotunda.  Â         The Man Founding Father... Revolutionary... Renaissance Man.  Thomas Jefferson was the primary author of the Declaration of Independence document,  first Secretary of State for the United States of America, and a complex, 19th century man with a wide ranging impact on the very makeup of America itself.
